_header: Though our lord Jesu Christ dead was upon the Rood
Subjects: hell, harrowing of; Jerusalem, destruction of
_description: The Harrowing of Hell and the Destruction of Jerusalem, in the Temporale of the South English Legendary — 542 lines

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
Þo oure lord Ihesu crist ded was vp on þe rodeIoseph of
                    Armaþie wond hym in cloþis goode…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…but ȝif þei to cristendome here hertis wil wendeand
                    ihesu for þi grete grace hem þerto sone sende
CamStJohn28.Note: In this MS incorporated as part of 3452.
CamStJohn28.Attributed Title: Explicit temporale in Anglicis quod Rose (f. 79)
